articles.author: Hannah Confino
articles.description: The Israeli ambassador to the United States was quoted saying a deal could transpire within days.
articles.title: Israel moving towards Hezbollah ceasefire but issues remain, spokesperson says

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Emilie Madi
articles.description: The massive Israeli strike hit the densely populated Basta Fawqa neighbourhood just before dawn on Saturday.
articles.title: Deadliest Israeli strike yet on central Beirut leaves gruesome scenes

articles.author: Alvise Armellini
articles.description: The Group of Seven democracies are seeking a common position on the arrest warrant for Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu issued last week by the International Criminal Court (ICC), Italian Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani said on Monday.
articles.title: G7 seeks unity on ICC arrest warrant for Netanyahu

articles.author: Luiza Ilie, Mara Vilcu
articles.description: A hard-right critic of NATO who has praised Russia is set to face a centre-right opposition leader in a presidential election run-off in Romania that could undermine its pro-Western stance after a shock outcome in the first-round vote.
articles.title: In election shock, Romanian far-right NATO critic set for presidential contest

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Europeans will step up military support for Ukraine, Germany's defence minister pledged on Monday after talks with his British, French, Italian and Polish counterparts on how to foster defence efforts as Donald Trump is set to return to the White House.
articles.title: Europeans will ramp up military support for Ukraine, says German defence minister

articles.author: Asif Shahzad
articles.description: At least one police officer was killed and dozens of people injured in Pakistan as supporters of jailed former Prime Minister Imran Khan clashed with security forces outside the capital Islamabad on Monday, officials and Khan's party said.
articles.title: One killed, dozens injured in clashes with Imran Khan's supporters near Pakistan's capital

articles.author: Andrius Sytas
articles.description: A DHL cargo plane crashed near Lithuania’s Vilnius airport on Monday at about 0330 GMT, killing one person and injuring two others, airport, police and firefighter officials told Reuters.
articles.title: One dead, two injured in DHL cargo plane crash near Vilnius airport

articles.author: Gabriela Selser
articles.description: Nicaragua's parliament on Monday approved a law that seeks to nullify foreign sanctions issued against President Daniel Ortega's vice president and wife Rosario Murillo, several of their children and some 50 high-ranking state officials.
articles.title: Nicaraguan lawmakers pass bill forcing local banks to ignore foreign sanctions

articles.author: Sarah Morland
articles.description: Survivors of sexual violence in Haiti face worsening risks and dwindling support amid the growing influence of armed gangs, a collapsed healthcare system and a frozen justice system, a report warned on Monday.
articles.title: Haiti's sexual violence survivors face dwindling support, report warns

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian missiles damaged residential buildings in Ukraine's eastern city of Kharkiv and Odesa in the south, and a blizzard of drones caused temporary power cuts in Mykolaiv region and targeted the capital Kyiv, Ukrainian officials said on Monday.
articles.title: Russian drones, missiles attack Ukraine's east, south and capital
